title: Lightweight End-to-end Text-to-speech Synthesis for low resource on-device applications
author: Biel Tura Vecino (Alexa AI), Adam Gabrys (Alexa AI), Daniel M ˛atwicki (Alexa AI), Andrzej Pomirski (Alexa AI), Tom Iddon (Alexa AI), Marius Cotescu (Alexa AI), Jaime Lorenzo-Trueba (Alexa AI), ..., Adam Gabrys
relevance_why: The proposed Lightweight End-to-End Text-to-Speech (LE2E) model emphasizes efficiency and quality, which could inform developments in audio generation and restoration tasks such as speech synthesis and enhancement in Haohe's research.
background: Developing a compact and efficient text-to-speech synthesis model that can operate on low-resource devices, providing high-quality voice outputs without relying on extensive computational resources.
contribution: This paper introduces the Lightweight E2E-TTS (LE2E) model, which solves the challenges of producing high-quality speech synthesis in low-resource scenarios, achieving a 90% reduction in model size and 10× faster processing speed compared to existing state-of-the-art systems.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models like VITS and JETS provide high-quality TTS synthesis but are computationally expensive and unsuitable for on-device applications.
technical_comparison.novelty: LE2E streamlines the training process by employing a joint training architecture that integrates both the acoustic model and vocoder into a single system, eliminating cross-domain training mismatches.

key_innovation: Combines acoustic representation learning with waveform generation in a compact model to enhance performance without requiring multiple individual training pipelines.
real_world_impact: This model enables real-time speech synthesis on low-end devices, broadening access to TTS technology in various applications, especially where internet connectivity is not feasible.

new_terms.end-to-end (E2E): **End-to-end** refers to a modeling approach where the entire process of transforming an input (text) into an output (speech) is done through a single model, simplifying the workflow.
new_terms.mean opinion score (MOS): **Mean Opinion Score (MOS)** is a subjective measure used to evaluate the perceived quality of synthesized speech, usually rated by human listeners on a scale from 1 to 5.
